forumNotes.author: breaker
forumNotes.content:
> if i wanted my computer to boot strate into dos command prompt ever time  
> no menu in windows 7 is this possible?  
> where do i start?  
> thanks

First, you of course know Windows 7 doesn't include DOS. Therefore you need a real PC style DOS like FreeDOS or MS-DOS. Of course it needs to be on a formatted partition it understands (FAT32 not NTFS). Once that is sorted, you can install the program EasyBCD (in Windows 7) to help you load DOS directly from the Windows 7 boot loader. NO you don't need a 3rd party boot manager in your MBR.
